title: England's victory sealed with a kiss as Harpenden starts to party
text:
The moment Nigel Owens blasted the final whistle at the Yokohama International Stadium to herald England’s place in the Rugby World Cup final, the celebrations began in earnest more than 6,000 miles away at Harpenden Rugby Football Club.

It was at this Hertfordshire club that England captain Owen Farrell honed his skills as a youngster – they remember him well – and the sensational victory over New Zealand was celebrated with a spectacular kiss.

In the middle of the clubhouse bar sitting in front of the big screen, Steve Brown, who has been a key figure at Harpenden since he was a teenager, planted several kisses on the lips of Steve Johnson, the club’s long-suffering volunteer coordinator.

...
description: The moment Nigel Owens blasted the final whistle at the Yokohama International Stadium to herald England’s place in the Rugby World Cup final, the celebrations began in earnest more than 6,000 miles away at Harpenden Rugby Football Club.
